required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Cerebral Palsy and Sleep Apnea in North Part of Finland
clinical_study.official_title: Obstructive Sleep Apnea as a Risk Factor for Cerebral Palsy, a Prospective Study

brief_summary.textblock: Obstructive sleep apnoea is a risk factor for cerebral palsy. study hypothesis: In prospective study the investigators want to know how many cerebral palsy patients have sleep apnoea and does thrombolysis play a role in severity of osa in six months follow up.

detailed_description.textblock: In prospective study the investigators include all over 18 years old patients who came to emergency room for cerebral palsy.Exclusion criteria is not able to co-operate or need for intensive care unit.The investigators shall take 100 control patients who have cerebral palsy and no thrombolysis and 100 study patients who will have thrombolysis. The investigators do sleep registration during hospital staying within 2 days after patients have felt ill.Follow-up registration will be done after 6 months at home.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case Control, Time Perspective: Prospective

primary_outcome.measure: cerebral palsy events and severity of osa
primary_outcome.time_frame: from six months to twenty four months
primary_outcome.description: in prospective study outcome measure is severity of osa in 6months follow-up

arm_group.description: Nasal-cpap treatment and compliance in sleep apnea patients with cerebral palsy. No Nasal-cpap treatment in sleep apnea patients with cerebral palsy. Severity of sleep apnea in thrombolysis patients and in control patients. Thrombolysis reduces severity of sleep apnea.Sleep apnea is common among cerebral palsy patients.
No nasal-cpap in sleep apnea patients with cerebral palsy

study_pop.textblock: residents of Oulu university hospital area. consecutive patient sampling

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- over 18 years old patients that have cerebral palsy and are able to participate to the study.
Exclusion Criteria:
- no co-operation and need for intensive care unit
